III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) The facility is in compliance with all ISEP requirements.
3.) The facility is in compliance with all DHHS Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. CONSULTATION:
There was a discussion with the case manager about timeframes, and where to enter
social work contacts and the resident’s new location on the updated action summary
form (DHHS-69).
V. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The facility submitted one corrective action plan for a special investigation in
2018. The issues cited involved the facility not following DHHS termination and
release procedures, and having an outdated admission grid and incident report
policy. The facility updated their admission grid and incident report policy, and
agreed to follow the DHHS termination and release policy.
In the 2018 Renewal report, the facility was cited for R 400.4156 Updated service plan;
late reports. There were no repeats of these citations.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules, ISEP requirements and DHH contracts and policy. It is
recommended that the facility continue on their regular license.
